html.question: What does the abbreviation HTML stand for?
html.hint: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.

html.question: What is the correct HTML element for the largest heading?
html.hint: HTML heading elements are defined with the <h1> to <h6> tags. <h1> defines the most important heading, while <h6> defines the least important heading.

html.question: Which HTML attribute specifies an alternate text for an image, if the image cannot be displayed?
html.hint: The 'alt' attribute provides alternative text for images. It is important for accessibility and SEO purposes.

html.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink?
html.hint: The <a> tag defines a hyperlink, and the 'href' attribute specifies the URL of the page the link goes to.

html.question: Which character is used to indicate the end of an HTML tag?
html.hint: HTML tags are enclosed in angle brackets, < and >. The end of a tag is indicated by a forward slash (/) before the tag name.

html.question: Which HTML tag is used to define an unordered list?
html.hint: The <ul> tag defines an unordered (bulleted) list.

html.question: Which HTML attribute is used to define inline styles?
html.hint: The 'style' attribute is used to define inline styles directly within an HTML element.

html.question: What is the correct HTML for adding a background color?
html.hint: Inline styles can be applied directly to HTML elements using the 'style' attribute. The 'background-color' property sets the background color.

html.question: Which HTML element is used to define important text?
html.hint: The <strong> tag is used to define text with strong importance. It renders text in bold by default.

html.question: Which HTML attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field?
html.hint: The 'placeholder' attribute provides a hint to the user about what to enter in an input field. It's typically used for text input fields.

html.question: What is the correct HTML for making a checkbox?
html.hint: The <input> tag is used to create an input field, and the 'type' attribute specifies the type of input. To create a checkbox, use 'checkbox' as the value of the 'type' attribute.

html.question: What does HTML stand for?
html.hint: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, which is used to create web pages.

html.question: Which HTML tag is used to define the footer of a webpage or a section?
html.hint: The <footer> tag defines a footer for a document or a section. It typically contains information about the author, copyright information, etc.

html.question: In HTML, which attribute is used to specify that an input field must be filled out?
html.hint: The 'required' attribute specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form.

html.question: Which HTML element is used to define the navigation links in HTML5?
html.hint: The <nav> tag is used to define navigation links in HTML5. It typically contains a list of links to other pages or sections within the same page.

html.question: What is the correct HTML for inserting a line break?
html.hint:
The
tag is used to insert a single line break. It's a self-closing tag.

html.question: Which HTML element is used to define a table row?
html.hint: The <tr> tag is used to define a table row in HTML. It's used within the <table> element.

html.question: Which HTML element is used to define a cell in a table?
html.hint: The <td> tag is used to define a standard cell in a.

html.question: Which HTML element is used to define a header for a webpage or a section?
html.hint: The <header> tag defines a header for a document or a section. It typically contains introductory content or navigation links.

html.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink to an email address?
html.hint: To create a hyperlink to an email address, use the 'mailto:' protocol followed by the email address within the 'href' attribute.

html.question: Which HTML element is used to define the title of a webpage?
html.hint: The <title> tag is used to define the title of a webpage, which appears in the browser's title bar or tab.

html.hint: The <ul> tag is used to define an unordered list in HTML. Items in this list are typically displayed with bullet points.

html.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink to another webpage?
html.hint: To create a hyperlink to another webpage, use the 'href' attribute with the URL of the destination page.

html.hint: The <strong> tag is used to define text with strong importance. It renders text in bold by default.

html.hint: The <tr> tag is used to define a table row in HTML. It's used within the <table> element.

html.question: What does the HTML acronym DOCTYPE stand for?
html.hint: DOCTYPE stands for Document Type Declaration. It informs the web browser about the type and version of HTML used in a web document.

html.hint: The 'src' attribute is used to specify the URL of the image to be displayed in an tag.

html.hint: The <head> element is used to define the structure of an HTML document, including metadata, links to external resources, and more.

html.hint: The <ol> tag is used to create an ordered (numbered) list in HTML.

html.hint: The <hr> tag is used to define a horizontal line in HTML. It is often used to separate content.

html.hint: The tag is used to insert an image in HTML. The 'src' attribute specifies the URL of the image, and the 'alt' attribute provides alternative text for accessibility.

html.hint: The <section> tag is used to define a section of a document in HTML. It is typically used to group related content.

html.hint: The <li> tag is used to define a list item in HTML, whether in an ordered (numbered) list or an unordered (bulleted) list.

html.hint: The <button> tag is used to define a clickable button in HTML. It can be used to submit forms or trigger JavaScript functions.

js.hint: This operator evaluates to true if either of its operands is true.

js.question: Which method is used to remove the last element from an array and return that element?
js.hint: This method modifies the array by removing the last element.

js.question: What is the purpose of the 'continue' statement in JavaScript?
choices: To skip the current iteration of a loop and continue with the next iteration
To jump to a specified label in the code
js.hint: This statement is used to skip the current iteration of a loop.

js.question: Which method is used to add new items to the beginning of an array?
js.hint: This method modifies the array by adding new elements to the beginning.

js.question: What does the '&&' operator do in JavaScript?
js.hint: This operator evaluates to true if both of its operands are true.

js.question: Which function is used to convert a number to a string in JavaScript?
js.hint: This function converts a number to a string.

js.question: What does the 'typeof' operator return for functions in JavaScript?
js.hint: The 'typeof' operator returns the type of its operand.

js.question: Which built-in method is used to execute a function after a specified number of milliseconds?
js.hint: This method is used to execute a function after a specified delay.

js.question: How do you access the first element of an array?
js.hint: Array indexing starts from 0 in JavaScript.

js.question: What is the result of the following expression: '5' == 5?
js.hint: The '==' operator performs type coercion before comparing values.

js.question: Which built-in method is used to remove the last element from an array and returns that element?
js.hint: This method modifies the array by removing the last element.

js.question: What is the purpose of the 'new' keyword in JavaScript?
choices: To define a new object property
To create an instance of a constructor function
js.hint: This keyword is used to create an instance of a constructor function.

js.question: What is the output of the following code: console.log(1 + '2' + '2');?
js.hint: JavaScript performs implicit type conversion when using the '+' operator with strings and numbers.

js.question: Which method is used to determine if a string includes another string?
js.hint: This method checks whether a string contains the specified characters.

js.question: What is the purpose of the 'typeof' operator in JavaScript?
choices: To declare the type of a variable
To determine the type of an operand
js.hint: The 'typeof' operator returns the type of its operand.

js.question: Which function is used to convert a string to uppercase letters?
js.hint: This function converts all the alphabetic characters in a string to uppercase.

js.hint: The '==' operator performs type coercion before comparing values.

js.question: Which method is used to join elements of an array into a string?
js.hint: This method joins all elements of an array into a string.

js.question: What does the '===' operator do in JavaScript?
js.hint: The '===' operator checks for strict equality without type conversion.

js.question: How do you declare a function in JavaScript using function expression?
js.hint: Function expressions are assigned to variables.

js.question: Which method is used to remove the first element from an array and return that element?
js.hint: This method modifies the array by removing the first element.

js.question: What is the output of the following code: console.log(2 * '2' + 3);?
js.hint: JavaScript performs implicit type conversion when using arithmetic operators with strings and numbers.

js.question: What is the purpose of the 'isNaN()' function in JavaScript?
choices: To check if a value is NaN (Not-a-Number)
To convert a value to a number
To check if a value is infinite
To round a number to the nearest integer
js.hint: This function checks whether a value is NaN (Not-a-Number).

js.question: Which method is used to convert a string to an array?
js.hint: This method splits a string into an array of substrings.

js.question: What does the '!=='' operator do in JavaScript?
js.hint: The '!==' operator checks for strict inequality without type conversion.

js.question: Which function is used to round a number down to the nearest integer?
js.hint: This function returns the largest integer less than or equal to a given number.

js.question: What is the result of the following expression: true && false?
js.hint: The '&&' operator evaluates to true if both of its operands are true.

js.question: Which method is used to execute a function repeatedly at specified intervals?
js.hint: This method repeatedly calls a function or executes a code snippet, with a fixed time delay between each call.

js.question: What is the purpose of the 'void' operator in JavaScript?
choices: Evaluates an expression without returning a value
js.hint: The 'void' operator evaluates an expression without returning a value.

js.question: Which method is used to sort the elements of an array?
js.hint: This method sorts the elements of an array in place and returns the sorted array.

js.hint: The '||' operator evaluates to true if either of its operands is true.

js.hint: JavaScript performs implicit type conversion when using the '+' operator with strings and numbers.

js.question: What is the output of the following code: console.log(typeof(42));?
js.hint: The 'typeof' operator returns the data type of its operand.

js.question: Which method is used to return the length of a string?
js.hint: This method returns the number of characters in a string.

js.question: What is the purpose of the 'concat()' method in JavaScript?
choices: To remove elements from an array
To sort elements in an array
To concatenate two or more strings
To add elements to an array
js.hint: This method is used to concatenate two or more strings and return a new string.

js.question: Which operator is used to find the remainder of a division operation?
js.hint: This operator returns the remainder of a division operation.

js.hint: Dividing a non-zero number by zero results in positive or negative infinity.

js.hint: This method removes the last element from an array and returns that element.

js.hint: The unary plus operator converts its operand to a number.

js.question: What is the purpose of the 'toFixed()' method in JavaScript?
choices: To round a number down to the nearest integer
To round a number up to the nearest integer
To format a number with a fixed number of decimal places
To convert a number to a string
js.hint: This method formats a number using fixed-point notation.

js.hint: This method converts a number to a string.

js.hint: This method converts all the alphabetic characters in a string to lowercase.

js.hint: The 'isNaN()' function checks if a value is NaN (Not-a-Number).

js.hint: This operator raises the left operand to the power of the right operand.

js.hint: The '==' operator performs type coercion before comparing values.

js.hint: This method converts all the alphabetic characters in a string to uppercase.

js.question: What does the 'indexOf()' method return if the specified substring is not found in the string?
js.hint: The 'indexOf()' method returns the index of the first occurrence of a specified substring in a string.

js.question: Which function is used to convert a string to an integer?
js.hint: This function parses a string argument and returns an integer.

js.question: What is the output of the following code: console.log(null == undefined);?
js.hint: In JavaScript, null and undefined are considered equal when using loose equality.

js.question: What is the purpose of the 'charAt()' method in JavaScript?
choices: To convert a string to uppercase
To return the character at a specified index
To check if a string contains another string
js.hint: This method returns the character at a specified index in a string.

js.question: Which method is used to convert a string to an array?
js.hint: This method splits a string into an array of substrings.

js.question: What does the 'splice()' method do in JavaScript?
choices: Changes the contents of an array by removing or replacing existing elements
Adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length
Removes the last element from an array and returns that element
Returns the first element of an array
js.hint: This method changes the contents of an array by removing or replacing existing elements.

js.question: Which method is used to find the first occurrence of a specified value in an array?
js.hint: This method returns the index of the first occurrence of a specified value in an array, or -1 if not found.

js.hint: The '==' operator performs type coercion before comparing values.

js.hint: This function formats a number using fixed-point notation.

js.hint: The 'typeof' operator returns the data type of its operand.

js.question: Which method is used to execute a function once for each array element?
js.hint: This method executes a provided function once for each array element.

js.hint: In JavaScript, null is treated as 0 when used with arithmetic operators.

js.hint: This function parses a string argument and returns a floating-point number.
